NOTE: The names of Wellspring Lutheran Services staff, Eagle Village staff,
and foster children are coded though out this report including the original
complaint below to ensure privacy and confidentiality.
ALLEGATION:
It is alleged that an agency worker lacked supervision of two foster children who are
alleged to have engaged in sexual relations.
On 08/16/19 DCWL received the following complaint: “Foster Child A (14) is
currently in foster care and is placed at Eagle Village (residential program) in Hersey
MI. Staff 1 is Foster Child A’s foster care caseworker through Wellspring Lutheran
Services. Foster Child B is another foster youth on Staff 1’s caseload.”
“Earlier this year (date not specified), Foster Child A attended a youth conference at
Saginaw Valley State University (SVSU) with Staff 1 and another foster youth,
Foster Child B. It has been alleged that while Staff 1, Foster Child A and Foster
Child B were at the conference that Foster Child A lost her virginity to Foster Child B.
Staff 1 is believed to have been responsible for supervising the youth during this
conference at SVSU.”
INVESTIGATION:
On 08/22/19 this writer initiated a special investigation into the allegation described
above. Agency staff from two agencies and foster children were interviewed. The
interviews were conducted jointly with another DHHS Worker. Documents were also
reviewed. What follows is information obtained from the aforementioned sources.
On 08/26/19 the Director of Admissions at Eagle Village residential facility was
interviewed. Foster Child A is currently placed at Eagle Village and is a foster child
of Wellspring Lutheran Services in Gaylord MI. The Director of Admissions offered
the following information. Foster Child A was placed at Eagle Village on 07/15/19.
Foster Child A receives regular visits from her Wellspring Lutheran Services
caseworker, hereafter referred to as Staff 1. Staff 1 has been observed by Eagle
Village staff to tell Foster Child A that she loves her. Specifically, Staff 1 has been
overheard to say to Foster Child A, “I love you” and “I want you to come live with
me”. The Director of Admissions reported that the staff at Eagle Village have been
concerned about inappropriate boundaries between Staff 1 and Foster Child A.
On 08/26/19 Foster Child A, age 14, was interviewed at Eagle Village. Foster Child
A offered the following information. She attended the Michigan Teen Conference in
June 2019 at Saginaw Valley State University (SVSU). Staff 1 and another
Wellspring staff, hereafter referred to as Staff 2, took her, Foster Child B, and
3

another foster youth (Foster Child C) to the conference. The conference involved an
overnight stay at SVSU.
Staff 1 and 2 stayed in the same dorm unit as Foster Child A and three other foster
children. The unit has three bedrooms. Staff 1 and 2 stayed in one of the bedrooms,
Foster Child A stayed in a bedroom by herself and three other foster children stayed
in the third bedroom. Foster Child A reported that she stayed by Staff 1 for most of
the first day and evening of the conference. Later in the evening Staff 1 and 2,
Foster Child A and B, as well as the other foster children were “hanging out” in
Foster Child’s dorm unit talking. Around midnight Staff 2 went to bed while Staff 1
continued to supervise the foster children and soon thereafter Foster Child A, Staff
1, and the three other foster girls went to bed. Foster Child B along with his
chaperone returned to their respective dorm unit. Foster Child A reported that Foster
Child B had said that he would sneak out of his dorm unit and come to her room
later in the evening. Foster Child A reported that Foster Child B entered Foster
Childs dorm window and she had unlocked the window so he could get in. Foster
Child A stated that she was not feeling safe and Foster Child B held her hand and
she and Foster Child B began hugging and kissing. Foster Child A reported that she
and Foster Child B had become best friends at the conference. Foster Child A
reported that she was too scared to say no and one thing led to another and they
had sex. Foster Child A reported that she and Foster Child B then lay on the bed for
a while and then had sex again. Foster Child A reported that she did not say no to
having sex. Foster Child A reported that Foster Child B then returned to his room.
Foster Child A reported that a few days later she told Staff 1 about the incident.
Foster Child A reported that Staff 1 said, “I love you and care about you and I could
adopt you”, and “You are my favorite kid on my caseload”.
On 09/03/19 Foster Child B was interviewed at his foster home by another DHHS
Worker. What follows is the interview in part:
Foster Child B was asked if he is aware of why this worker was there to talk with
him. He states that he went to SVSU for a student conference. He states that he
and a girl there have the same case manager. He states that he and that girl
had sex while they were at the conference. Foster Child B was asked what his
caseworkers name is and he states Staff 1. He states he does not know her last
name. He was asked what the name of the girl is that he had sex with and he
states "Foster Child A.”
Foster Child B states that they each were assigned to a dorm room. He states
that Foster Child A was in the same dorm as Staff 1. They shared a living room
area by each had their own bedrooms. He states that he and Foster Child A had
sex in her bedroom. He states that this happened at night and it was while Staff
1 was sleeping. He denies that Staff 1 had any prior knowledge of their plans to
have sex. He states that Foster Child A told her after and that Staff 1 confirmed
with him. He does not know or remember when he told Staff 1 that they had had
sex.
4

Foster Child B states that there were other youth that were aware. He said that
he does not know the girl's name. She was in a different bedroom than Foster
Child A but in the same dorm. He states that his roommate Foster Child C was
planning to have sex with that girl. He said that the girl was made aware and
that she was going to sneak into the room that he shared with Foster Child C.
He said that’s how she knew that he and Foster Child A we’re going to be
having sex. Foster Child B states “kind of like a you scratch my back I’ll scratch
yours, kind of thing.
Foster Child B denies that he knew Foster Child A prior to going to the teen
conference. He states that he just met her there and they shared the same
caseworker. Foster Child B states that the teen conference was on the weekend. He
states that they just met and were talking and decided to have sex. He denies that
there was anything more to this. He again denies that the caseworker was aware of
their plan.
Foster Child B was asked how he got into the girl's dorm room. He states that Foster
Child A unlocked her bedroom window so that he could get in. He states that the
room she was in was on the ground level. Foster Child B states that there were
bunkbeds in the room but she was not sharing a bedroom with anyone. This
happened at night when the caseworker was in her room and sleeping. Foster Child
B had no other information to provide about the incident.”
On 09/10/19 telephone contact was made to Staff 1 by this writer and another DHHS
Worker. Staff 1 was at work and could not be interviewed at that time so an interview
was scheduled for the next day, 09/11/19.
On 09/11/19 Staff 1 was interviewed by telephone. Staff 1 offered the following
information. She attended the conference at SVSU with Staff 2 and Foster Children
A and B and C. Staff 1 and 2 shared a bedroom, Foster Child A had her own
bedroom and three other female foster youth stayed in the third bedroom. Foster
child B stayed in another dorm unit. Staff 1 reported that they were told by
conference staff that staff cannot share the same bedroom with youth attending the
conference. Staff 1 reported that during the early evening hours she and Staff 2
were with Foster Child A and the other foster youth. They went to a local store and
visited the lounge area of the dorm. Staff 1 reported that by 11:00pm they were back
into their dorm unit and stayed up for a while talking. Staff 1 reported around
midnight everyone went to bed and Foster Child B and C went back to their dorm
unit with their chaperone. Staff 1 reported that it is Wellspring policy that the foster
children are to remain in sight of staff at all times except during sleeping hours. Staff
1 reported that she did not go to bed until all the foster children were in their
bedrooms for the night. Staff 1 reported that she arose around 2-3am to use the
bathroom and checked on Foster Child A who was found sleeping. Staff 1 reported
that the next day the conference ended and she took Foster Child A back to her
foster home. Staff 1 reported the day after this, Foster Child A was taken to Safe
5

House in Rose City as she was experiencing anxiety and depression. Staff 1 stated
that she then visited Foster Child A at Safe house and it was then that Foster Child
A informed her that she and Foster Child B had sex at the conference. Staff 1 stated
that Foster Child A had informed her that the sex was consensual. Staff 1 reported
that she called her supervisor, hereafter referred to as Supervisor, and informed her
of the incident. Staff 1 stated that she informed her that Foster Child A had said the
sex between her and Foster Child B was consensual.
On 11/07/19 the Wellspring Program Supervisor was interviewed at the agency. The
Supervisor offered the following information. She stated that she has been a
chaperone at the Michigan Teen Conference in previous years and chaperones are
required to sleep in bedrooms separate from the youth attending the conference.
The Supervisor reported that this is required by the Teen Conference staff. She
stated that she did not have any concerns about the supervision provided by Staff 1,
Staff 2, and Chaperone A. Chaperone A is the husband of the Supervisor and was
responsible for chaperoning Foster Children B and C.
On 11/07/19 Staff 2 was interviewed. Staff 2 offered the following information. Staff 2
reported that sleeping room arrangements were as described by Foster Child A and
Staff 1. Staff 2 reported that Foster Children A, B, C, were closely supervised by
herself, Staff 1 and Chaperone A throughout the day and evening of the conference.
Staff 2 reported that she and Staff 1, Foster Children A, B, and C as well as the
three other foster children were in the dorm unit talking until late in the evening. Staff
2 reported that she went to bed around 11:00pm, leaving supervision of the foster
children to Staff 1. Staff 2 reported that bedrooms have a lock and key and Foster
Child A had a key to her own bedroom. Staff 2 reported that she did not have any
concerns with her own supervision of the foster children as well as no concern with
Staff 1’s or Chaperone A’s supervision. Staff 2 reported that a couple of days later
Staff 1 informed her of the incident between Foster Child A and B.
On 11/07/19 a review of the foster care files of Foster Child A and B was conducted.
Foster Child A has a history of depression and is taking psychotropic medication.
Foster Child A is a temporary court ward/neglect and has been in foster care for
approximately 10 years. The file information is otherwise unremarkable.
Foster Child B has a history of Post Traumatic Stress Disorder and Adjustment
Disorder with mixed Depression and Anxiety. Foster Child B is a temporary court
ward/neglect and is resides in a foster home. The file information is otherwise
unremarkable.
On 11/07/19 a review of the Michigan Teen Challenge chaperone and onsite contact
agreement was reviewed. Staff 1 and 2 each signed the document. The document
contains supervision requirements as well as other conference standards that need
to be followed, including that chaperones are prohibited by Michigan Teen Challenge
from sleeping in the same bedrooms with youth attending the conference..
6

APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.12206 Staff qualifications
(1) An agency shall require a staff member who has
ongoing contact with children or parents to be a person
who has the ability, experience, education, and training
to perform the duties assigned.
ANALYSIS: Chaperones are prohibited by Michigan Teen Challenge from
sleeping in the same bedrooms with youth attending the
conference. Staff 1 reported being with and supervising Foster
Child A and the three other youth attending the conference at all
times except during the night-time sleeping hours. Staff 2
reported supervising Foster Child A and the three other youth
until she went to bed at 11:00pm. Foster Child A reported being
with Staff 1 the whole day of the conference and into the
evening hours.
Foster Child A and B had planned to see each other late at night
after everyone was in bed. Foster Child B sneaked out of his
dorm unit and entered through the unlocked bedroom window of
Foster Child A.
Evidence indicates that supervision was proper. Constant and
direct line of sight of Foster Child A and B during the night-time
sleeping hours was not required and Staff 1 and 2 did not have
prior knowledge that Foster Child A and B had planned to get
together after everyone had gone to bed.
Evidence indicates that supervision was proper.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
ADDITIONAL FINDINGS:
During the course of this investigation additional information of concern was
obtained and is presented below.
On 08/26/19 the Eagle Village Family Therapist, (hereafter referred to as Therapist),
for Foster Child A was interviewed. The Therapist reported that she, Foster Child A,
and Staff 1 would sit down together when Staff 1 came to visit. The Therapist
7

reported that Foster Child A knew of detail about Staff 1’s family. The Therapist also
reported Staff 1 had said, “I thought about adopting her”. The Therapist also
reported that Staff 1 had been heard to say to Foster Child A, “I love you” and “I
want you to come live with me”.
During the 08/26/19 interview with the Director of Admissions she also had reported
that Staff 1 was overheard saying she loved Foster Child A. (See interview with
Director above).
Foster Child A reported during the 08/26/19 interview the following, “Foster Child A
reported that Staff 1 said to her, “I love you and care about you and I could adopt
you”, and “You are my favorite kid on my caseload”. During the interview Foster
Child A reported that she loves Staff 1.
Staff 1, during the 09/11/19 interview, was asked about the nature of her relationship
with Foster Child A. Staff 1 stated, “we had a good relationship and I felt a strong
need to be there for her”. Staff 1 stated that she had told Foster Child A that she
would always be there for her even when she was an adult. Staff 1 denied ever
saying to Foster Child A that she loved her. Staff 1 reported that she and Foster
Child A would text and call each other. Staff 1 reported that she had given Foster
Child A her personal cell phone number.
During the 11/07/19 interview with the Supervisor she informed this writer that Staff
1’s employment had been terminated, in part for Staff 1 having inappropriate
boundaries with clients.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.12206 Staff qualifications
(1) An agency shall require a staff member who has
ongoing contact with children or parents to be a person
who has the ability, experience, education, and training
to perform the duties assigned.
8

ANALYSIS: The Director and Therapist each reported concerns about Staff
1’s relationship with Foster Child A. The Therapist reported that
Staff 1 had expressed interest in adopting Foster Child A. The
Therapist reported that Foster Child A knew details of Staff 1’s
family. The Director reported that Eagle Village staff had heard
Staff 1 say she loves Foster Child A. Foster Child A reported
that Staff 1 had said she loves her and cares about her and
could adopt her and that she was the favorite kid on her
caseload.
Staff 1 admitted to texting and phone calls with Foster Child A
using personal cell phones. Staff 1 reported having a strong
need to be there for Foster Child A even as she attained
adulthood and said she would always be there for her.
Evidence indicates that Staff 1 demonstrated inappropriate
boundaries with Foster Child A.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan the recommendation is for
continuance of the regular license.
